intro: Tripogandra disgrega f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy tripogandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescences. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its hairy foliage is a distinguishing trait of this particular form. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas.
